Service routines and db access for the Auth layer

Bases: object

Contains application methods relevant to the Authentication layer

Fetch a user by user id.

Parameters:user_id – Unique user id.
Returns:A User db model.
static verify_auth(user, password)[source]¶

Verify the password authenticates a given user.

Parameters:
  • user – A User model.
  • password – Input password.
Returns:

If the user is authenticated.

Contains methods related to the sendgrid mail provider

static send_email(to_email, subject, text, substitutions=None)[source]¶

Send an email to the recipient.

Parameters:
  • to_email – Recipient email address.
  • subject – Email subject.
  • text – Email body.
  • substitutions – Text substitution that should be applied.
Returns:

A (mail, response) tuple.

ovs.services.meal_service module¶

DB and utility functions for Meals

class ovs.services.meal_service.MealService[source]¶

Bases: object

DB and utility functions for Meals

static add_meals(pin, number)[source]¶

Add credits to meal plan identified by meal pin.

Parameters:
  • pin – Unique meal pin.
  • number – The number of credits to add.
static create_meal_plan(meal_plan, plan_type)[source]¶

Adds a MealPlan db entry.

Parameters:
  • meal_plan – The plan’s maximum credit.
  • plan_type – The plan’s reset period.
Returns:

A MealPlan db model.
static create_meal_plan_for_resident_by_email(meal_plan, plan_type, email)[source]¶
Create a new meal plan db entry
and assign a meal plan pin to an existing resident identified by email.
Parameters:
  • meal_plan – The plan’s maximum credit.
  • plan_type – The plan’s reset period.
  • email – An email address.
Returns:

A MealPlan db model.
static delete_meal_plan(pin)[source]¶

Deletes a meal plan from the database.

Parameters:pin – Unique meal pin.
static edit_meal_plan(pin, credit=None, plan_meal_count=None, plan_type=None)[source]¶

Updates a meal plan with any provided info.

Parameters:
  • pin – Unique meal pin.
  • credit – Number of credits until the next reset_date.
  • plan_meal_count – Number of meals given at each reset_date.
  • plan_type – The plans reset period.
static get_aggregate_meal_usage()[source]¶

Gets a list of the number of meals used for each hour.

Returns:List of length 24 with each element representing an hour and its value being the average number of meals used for that hour over all days in the meal history.
static get_all_meal_plans()[source]¶

Fetch all meal plans in the database

Returns:A list of MealPlan db models.
static get_last_log(manager_id)[source]¶

Fetch the most recent meal log associated manager identified by manager id.

Parameters:manager_id – Unique user id.
Returns:A MealPlanHistory db model.
static get_log_to_undo(undo_date, manager_id)[source]¶

Get the meal log corresponding to the given undo for a specific manager.

Parameters:
  • undo_date – Datetime of undo.
  • manager_id – User id of manager who logged the meal that is being undone.
Returns:

A MealPlanHistory db model.
static get_logs()[source]¶

Returns a list of all meal logs.

Returns:A list of MealPlanHistory db model.
static get_meal_plan_by_pin(pin)[source]¶

Fetch the mean plan that is associated with the meal pin.

Parameters:pin – Unique meal pin.
Returns:A MealPlan db model.
static log_meal_history(resident_id, pin, manager_id, log_type)[source]¶

Adds a MealPlanHistory to db that logs the login/undo action.

Parameters:
  • resident_id – Unique resident id that identifies the user that the meal plan is associated with.
  • pin – Unique meal pin.
  • manager_id – Unique user id that identifies the manager that authorized the undo action.
  • log_type – log_types.MEAL_USED or log_types.UNDO
static undo_meal_use(manager_id, resident_id, pin)[source]¶
Adds a single credit back to meal plan identified by meal pin
and adds a MealService db entry.
Parameters:
  • manager_id – Unique user id that identifies the manager that authorized the undo.
  • resident_id – Unique id that identifies the resident that the meal plan is associated with.
  • pin – Unique meal pin.
static use_meal(pin, manager_id)[source]¶
Decrement credit for meal plan identified by meal pin
and log a MealService db entry.
Parameters:
  • pin – Unique meal pin.
  • manager_id – Unique user id.
Returns:

If the meal credit was deducted and logged succesfully.

Creates a package db entry.

  • checked_by – Name of checker.
  • checked_at – Time when the package was recieved by checker.
  • description – A short description of the package.

A Package db model.

Returns:Total number of packages.

Updates the receiver and description of Package identified by package_id.

Parameters:
  • package_id – Unique package id.
  • recipient_email – Recipient’s unique email.
  • description – A short description of the package.

  • preferred_email – Resident’s preferred email.
  • preferred_name – Resident’s preferred name.
  • phone_number – Resident’s phone number.
  • race – Resident’s race.
  • gender – Resident’s gender.

ovs.services.room_service module¶

DB access and other services for Rooms

class ovs.services.room_service.RoomService[source]¶

Bases: object

DB Access and utility methods for Rooms

static add_resident_to_room(email, room_number)[source]¶

Associates a resident with a room. Updates resident’s room number and occupants of room.

Parameters:
  • email – Resident’s email address.
  • room_number – The room number.
Raises:

ValueError – if email or room_number is invalid
static create_room(number, status, room_type, occupant_emails='')[source]¶

Create a room db entry.

Parameters:
  • number – The room number.
  • status – Current room status.
  • room_type – Room type.
  • occupant_emails – Resident’s email address seperated by ‘;’.
Returns:

A Room db model.
static delete_room(room_id)[source]¶

Deletes a room from the database.

Parameters:room_id – Unique room id.
static edit_room(room_id, room_number, status, room_type)[source]¶

Edits a room in the database.

Parameters:
  • room_id – Unique room id.
  • room_number – New room number
  • status – New room status string
  • room_type – New room type string
Returns:

Whether the room was updated succesfully
static get_all_rooms()[source]¶

Fetch all rooms except the default in the db.

Returns:A list of Room db models.
static get_empty_room_stats()[source]¶

Gets empty room statistics.

Returns:dictionary between room type and number of empty rooms of that type.
static get_room_by_id(room_id)[source]¶

Fetch a room identified by room id.

Parameters:room_id – Unique room id.
Returns:A Room db model.
static get_room_by_number(number)[source]¶

Fetch a Room model by room number.

Parameters:number – The room nmber.
Returns:A Room db model.
static room_exists(number)[source]¶

Checks if a room identified by room number exits.

Parameters:number – The room number.
Returns:If a matching room exists.

ovs.services.user_service module¶

DB and utility functions for Users

class ovs.services.user_service.UserService[source]¶

Bases: object

DB and utility functions for Users

static create_user(email, first_name, last_name, role, password=None)[source]¶

Add a user entry to db.

Parameters:
  • email – The user’s email address.
  • first_name – The user’s first name.
  • last_name – The user’s last name.
  • role – The user’s role.
  • password – The user’s password. If None a random one is generated.
Returns:

A User db model.
static delete_user(user_id)[source]¶

Deletes an existing user identified by user id.

Parameters:user_id – Unique user id.
Returns:
True if the user was successfuly deleted.
False if user_id refers to the last admin.
Return type:bool
static edit_user(user_id, email, first_name, last_name, role=None)[source]¶

Edits user identified by user id.

Parameters:
  • user_id – Unique user id.
  • email – The user’s email.
  • first_name – The user’s first_name.
  • last_name – The user’s last_name.
  • role – The user’s role, or None if it should not change.
Raises:

ValueError – If email is already registered.
Returns:

True if the user was successfully updated.

False if trying to change the role of the last admin
Return type:

bool
static get_user_by_email(email)[source]¶

Fetch a user identified by email.

Parameters:email – The user’s email address.
Returns:A User db model.
static get_user_by_id(user_id)[source]¶

Fetch a user identified by user id.

Parameters:user_id – Unique user id.
Returns:A User db model.
static reset_user(reset_user, new_password)[source]¶

Reset a given user’s password.

Parameters:
  • reset_user – User model to reset password of.
  • new_password – The new password to set for the given user.
Returns:

The updated User model.
static send_reset_email(email)[source]¶

Sends a password reset email to the email address associated with a user.

Parameters:email – The user’s email address.
static send_setup_email(email, first_name, last_name, role)[source]¶

Sends a setup email to the email address associated with a user.

Parameters:
  • email – The user’s email address.
  • first_name – The user’s first name.
  • last_name – The user’s last name.
  • role – The user’s role.
